file_content.text: You did well bringing Kira to us, but you're needed elsewhere. May the Force be with you.
Master Satele, my mission has become more complicated. Masters Orgus and Kiwiiks have disappeared.
I'm headed for Tatooine and Alderaan to find them, but first, my Padawan has something important to tell you. Kira?
I was born on Dromund Kaas. My parents were Sith.
Whew! Much easier the second time. There's more, obviously.
I should hope so. Give me time to assemble the Council. Most of us are still offworld....
...and then my Master convinced me to come here and tell you. That's pretty much everything
We've heard rumors about these Children of the Emperor before, but this finally confirms their existence.
Troubling, that we never sensed the truth about Kira when Master Kiwiiks brought her to us.
That makes her especially dangerous. She's can't be allowed to remain free.
Kira's Master should have a voice in this. What do you recommend?
The situation doesn't require a reaction. I just thought you should know the truth.
Nothing.
And now that we know, we can't ignore the threat she represents to our entire order.
I brought her to you because I wasn't sure what to do.
Honestly, I don't know.
Our path is clear. The girl is dangerous. She lied to us.
To allow her to remain a Padawan--become a Jedi Knight? It's inconceivable.
Is it? Did we not first learn of the Children of the Emperor from a Sith turned to the light?
Master Braga speaks the truth. No one is beyond redemption.
Arrest and interrogate her. Find out what she's still hiding.
Imprison her.
Exactly. Contain the threat until we understand it.
Jedi are not jailers, Master Kaedan. It's obvious she's told us everything she knows.
I reached out through the Force while Kira spoke. I detected sadness and confusion. Not malice.
Yes. Despite her origins, I feel no trace of the dark side within her.
It was natural for you to fear our reaction, considering your upbringing.
What's important now is that you leave your past behind and devote yourself to the Jedi. Can you do that?
I've been trying to ever since Master Kiwiiks found me.
Kira's a good Padawan. I trust her with my life.
It's true.
There you have it. I need no further proof of Kira's loyalty.
What do you think, Masters? Should Kira remain my Padawan?
Should Kira stay?
I see no reason to punish a student who admits her error.
I don't have time for debates. I need you people to make a decision.
Let's get this over with.
She's right. Darth Angral is still out there. We must act.
He's right. Darth Angral is still out there. We must act.
Agreed--and I believe the best course of action is to leave Kira where she is.
This is a mistake. If Master Kiwiiks were here, she'd tell you the same.
Until she returns, this Council's ruling stands. Kira is safest in your care.
I appreciate you giving her another chance.
Thank you.
I hope you're right about this, Master Satele.
If you say so.
Release your worries. Kira has earned our trust.
When the Emperor's Children hunt her again, what do you expect from me?
What if more Sith come?
We must learn more. Seize every opportunity to acquire knowledge about these people.
If that's how I can make amends, I'll do whatever it takes.
I promise I'll make you all proud... even you, Master Kaedan.
You did well bringing this to us, but you should return to your mission.
May the Force be with you on Tatooine and Alderaan....
